description: This file defines an 'Emitter' class used for generating and writing formatted code or text to a file, with features like indentation, line length management, and buffered output.

classes.name: Emitter
classes.description: A utility class for generating formatted text or code, managing indentation, line wrapping, and buffered output stream to a file.

methods.name: __init__
methods.description: Constructor initializing the emitter with a target filename, indentation size, and optional maximum line length.

methods.name: __enter__
methods.description: Enables use of the emitter in a context manager.

methods.name: __exit__
methods.description: Exits the context manager, flushes buffers, and closes the file if open.

methods.name: Line
methods.description: Adds a line of text to the buffer, managing line length by inserting newlines at commas if needed.

methods.name: Unindent
methods.description: Decreases indentation level, not below zero.

methods.name: Prepend
methods.description: Prepend lines from another emitter to the current buffer.

methods.name: Append
methods.description: Append lines from another emitter to the current buffer.

methods.name: FileName
methods.description: Returns the name of the file being written to, if applicable.

methods.name: Flush
methods.description: Writes buffered lines to the associated file.
